intro: Microcos henrici subsp. acuta, commonly known as the acute microcos, is a perennial herb native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its more acute leaf tips compared to other microcos species.
